Node.definition: = action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

Node.gloss: to take notice|to be mindful (of someone, something)
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans take notice of the misfortune or suffering of (other) humans, plants, or objects and intervene in order to help
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which humans feel and show great joy

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which humans experience great joy and act accordingly
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= indirect male progenitor
= action by which humans do wrong to people or deities
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt
= indirect male progenitor
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

Node.gloss: to consider|to ponder|to observe|to take note of|to have regard for|to give heed to|to study
Node.definition: = action by which humans think about someone or something accompanied by a willingness to translate their conclusions into action if needed

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
= bodies of water located east of Egypt and south of Israel; possibly referring to the Gulf of Suez and/or to the Gulf of Aqaba off the Red Sea

= bodies of water located east of Egypt and south of Israel; possibly referring to the Gulf of Suez and/or to the Gulf of Aqaba off the Red Sea|= northern part of Gulf of Suez; ► location where the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) crossed over into the Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula on their way out of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)

meaning unsure; probably: = a reed like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

= bodies of water located east of Egypt and south of Israel; possibly referring to the Gulf of Suez and/or to the Gulf of Aqaba off the Red Sea|= northern part of Gulf of Suez; ► location where the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) crossed over into the Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula on their way out of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)

meaning unsure; probably: = a reed like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible

= process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which humans, animals, plants, or objects remain in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= action by which humans or deities act without delay

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state
= state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= process by which someone senses a physical craving for food
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region
= action by which humans experience a desire for something to happen and communicate this to (other) humans or deities in the hope that they will intenvene on their behalf

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= state in which people, objects and places have undergone the rituals that are required to make them fit to be in the presence of God or to be used in his service
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death
= man; ◄ son of Eliab (אֱלִיאָב) tribe of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) ► rebelled against Moses (מֹשֶׁה) with Korah (קֹרַח) and Abiram (אֲבִירָם)
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= man; ◄ son of Eliab (אֱלִיאָב) tribe of Reuben; ► rebelled against Moses (מֹשֶׁה) together with Korah (קֹרַח) and Dathan (דָּתָן)
= process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= male young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained

= a mountain, also known as the mountain of God; ◄ it is located on the Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula, ► and known as the place where God appeared to Moses (מֹשֶׁה) and where later the law was given to Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) on their way to the promised land
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= causative action by which humans exchange an object, person, or deity that is in their possession or that they are associating with for another one

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation; another name for Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others

= bodies of water located east of Egypt and south of Israel; possibly referring to the Gulf of Suez and/or to the Gulf of Aqaba off the Red Sea|= northern part of Gulf of Suez; ► location where the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) crossed over into the Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula on their way out of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם)

meaning unsure; probably: = a reed like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= marker indicating that if the event in focus would not have been true another event would not haven taken place
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

Node.gloss: to (cause to) turn back|to cause to cease|to avert|to revoke
Node.definition: literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true
= action by which humans speak with anger and resentment
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which someone takes an oath

literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which deities make a solemn promise, invoking themselves as a witness by lack of a higher power, which, in the case of humans, is usually done while raising one's hand
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process or action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be killed or severely wounded by enemies

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: to cause to fall; hence: = causative process or action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to be killed or severely wounded by enemies
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which humans cause a substance or a set of small objects to divide itself and move into various directions

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans become involved with a deity through worship
= deity ◄ of Moab (מֹואָב)
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to trouble|to vex|to provoke to anger
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= process by which events happen at a large scale and with much impact
literally: heavy blow; = action by which humans or deites cause serious harm, injury, epidemic, or other affliction affecting an individual or group of people
= man; ◄ son of Eleazar (אֶלְעָזָר) high priest (כֹּהֵן) during last phase of exodus; tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)

Node.gloss: to withhold|to prevent|to keep from|to stop from|to close
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities keep people or objects from activities that they are normally involved in
literally: heavy blow; = action by which humans or deites cause serious harm, injury, epidemic, or other affliction affecting an individual or group of people
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to provoke to anger|to make angry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans act in a way that ensures that a deity becomes angry

Node.gloss: to suffer (harm)|to go badly|to be in trouble
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience difficulty or hardship as a consequence for wrong or harmful behavior
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of|because of
Node.definition: = particle linking proposition X to participant Y, by which Y represents the cause or beneficiary of X
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= action by which humans speak without due consideration as to attitude or content

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans join in or associate other humans; used to describe the combinations of different groups of peoples, suggesting social and religious confusion

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= supernatural being, ≈ associated with pagan worship
literally: to pour out blood; hence: = to wound or kill an animate being
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= the region inhabited by people who were regarded as descendants of Canaan, son of Ham (חָם) son of Noah (נֹחַ) settled by Abram (אַבְרָם)
= process by which land becomes impure as a result of the morally and ethically unacceptable things that happen there, ► and therefore unfit for God to associate with

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of life (נֶפֶשׁ) human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

= process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to humble; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities bring (other) humans and areas under their authority and control, usually using force
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
literally: to sink in; hence: = process by which humans lose their prosperity and security
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state by which humans or deities are having second thoughts about past actions or plans for the future

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= a person or entity ► that forcibly carries off an animal, person, or group
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= process by which humans consider themselves priviliged to be able to do something
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing a speaker's solemn confirmation of the truth of a statement
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
